channel.title: Sellsword Rework
channel.description:
> ## Sellsword > > Bribes - Start with 0 bribes for every bribe over 5( although you don't need any in order to win) you gain an extra 10 gold. > > Contracted - Immune to most occupation and redirection. You will automatically use Don Armour before the game starts similar to alch. > > Day Abilities: > Don Armour - use 1 bribe in order to make yourself death immune tonight.( 1 use) > >Train - Use 2 bribes in order to gain 1 more use of 1 of your night abilities(except rebound).(infinite) > > Night Abilities: >Contracted: > Guard - Prevent non-attack and non-conversion abilities targeting your target gain 1 bribe for all players prevented and 3 bribes for all conversion and attack abilities targeted on the player.( 4 uses) > Intermediate - Occupy a player, preventing them from taking any actions tonight, gain 1 bribe.( 3 uses) > Faction Allegiance - See if a player is a member of the unseen or cult.( 2 uses) > Rebound - Kill a player who voted up unseen or cult( must have been checked in order to use) , gain 3 bribes on a successful kill ( 1 use)
Don't Know if I should just remove bribe or nah

item.title: Sellsword Rework
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
RHCube:

That’s why I want to change the win con to survive.

I mean to his ability’s

Read full topic

item.title: Sellsword Rework
item.dc:creator: RHCube
item.description:
NuclearBurrito:

If you are going to buff sellsword then you should either justify how he isn’t impactful enough (Which is hard considering that he isn’t guaranteed making his existence swingy if he is too strong)

It’s not uncommon for evils to be unlucky and kill the sellsword early on, making Sellsword useless.

NuclearBurrito:

or you can counterbalance it with a nerf.

That’s why I want to change the win con to survive.

Read full topic

item.title: Sellsword Rework
item.dc:creator: Moleland
item.description:
I think one time immunity is fine. It stops Sellsword rando-dying night one.

Read full topic

item.title: Sellsword Rework
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
RHCube:

Alright, but do you agree that it should have a one-time night immunity? It’s common for evils to get unlucky and kill their sellsword early on before they get a chance to do anything useful.

One time night immunity is only fine on specific kits. If you are going to buff sellsword then you should either justify how he isn’t impactful enough (Which is hard considering that he isn’t guaranteed making his existence swingy if he is too strong) or you can counterbalance it with a nerf.

Read full topic

item.description:
It punishes scum for doing their job

Read full topic

item.title: Sellsword Rework
item.dc:creator: RHCube
item.description:
Alright, but do you agree that it should have a one-time night immunity? It’s common for evils to get unlucky and kill their sellsword early on before they get a chance to do anything useful.

Firelitten:

Masochist is bad and should feel bad

Am I the only one who like the concept of fool/night fool? Fool is a counter for VFC and random accusations. Night fool would help discourage yolo killing.

Read full topic

item.title: Sellsword Rework
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
Also right now every neutral besides NK, Neutral King, Pretender and Alch can win while dead

Read full topic

item.title: Sellsword Rework
item.dc:creator: Firekitten
item.description:
RHCube:

a night fool if it ever gets added

Masochist is bad and should feel bad

Read full topic

item.title: Sellsword Rework
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
I think you seem to be missing a mindset we are having about the Sellsword.

Spacificaly: the Sellsword IS a faction member in all but name.

We even have a name for it. Lost Wolf

Traditionally a Lost Wolf is considered to be a Wolf and not 3rd party. Since Sellsword is the equivalent of a lost wolf it stands to reason that he should win with his Allies just like an actual Lost Wolf does.

In mafia the term is instead traitor

Read full topic

item.title: Sellsword Rework
item.dc:creator: Moleland
item.description:
The class Imo is more fun if it is meant to run interference and be a diversion for scum.

Read full topic

item.title: Sellsword Rework
item.dc:creator: RHCube
item.description:
Moleland:

But it is a neutral evil, that’s only goal is to make BD lose

Again, they don’t have a faction to support themselves. It doesn’t make sense that they don’t have to survive, they have nobody supporting them(At least nobody has to support them, unlike factions).

Moleland:

It should be something important to consider ‘It’s 3 vs 2 - one of these guys is SS and one is MM - oh crap, lynched the wrong one.’

But that’s too easy. Sellsword had a 52.7% winrate last I checked. That’s too high for a single non-NK neutral.

Moleland:

I mean, if we change it to RH’s idea, Sellsword loses in the example I laid out.

And there’s nothing wrong with that. Only Fool(And a night fool if it ever gets added) and faction members should be able to win while dead.

NuclearBurrito:

However there are other secondary objectives that can be put onto a class besides survival

I wouldn’t be against trying it out, but that might be too confusing/complex.

Read full topic

item.title: Sellsword Rework

item.description:
A: no this rework is stoopid
B: Sellsword doesn’t need to survive imp, yes it has a high win rate but not higher then bds so it isn’t a problem at all

The only thing sellsword needs is maybe a one time night immunity and wincon turned to survive to see BD lose as it’s way too easy right now IMO

RHCube:

Sellsword is fine, the only change it needs is a one-time night immunity and having to survive to win

Then who is this?
